channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Crews recover bodies of all 9 skiers killed in California avalanche
item.description: The bodies of all the skiers who died in Tuesday's avalanche near Lake Tahoe have been recovered, authorities said Saturday. Intense winter storm conditions delayed search and recovery efforts.
item.content:encoded:
The bodies of all the skiers who died in Tuesday's avalanche near Lake Tahoe have been recovered, authorities said Saturday. Intense winter storm conditions delayed search and recovery efforts.

(Image credit: Godofredo A. Vásquez/AP)
item.dc:creator: Kristin Wright

item.title: NASA's Artemis II lunar mission may not launch in March after all
item.description: NASA says an "interrupted flow" of helium to the rocket system could require a rollback to the Vehicle Assembly Building. If it happens, NASA says the launch to the moon would be delayed until April.
item.content:encoded:
NASA says an "interrupted flow" of helium to the rocket system could require a rollback to the Vehicle Assembly Building. If it happens, NASA says the launch to the moon would be delayed until April.

(Image credit: Gregg Newton)
item.dc:creator: Russell Lewis

item.title: Hidden Levels podcast explains how the industry has grown from the arcade into a global juggernaut
item.description: Last year, the video game industry generated around $190 BILLION in revenue. More than the music and film industry combined. How did this medium go from the arcade into a global juggernaut? That's the subject of a new podcast series called Hidden Levels.
item.content:encoded: Last year, the video game industry generated around $190 BILLION in revenue. More than the music and film industry combined. How did this medium go from the arcade into a global juggernaut? That's the subject of a new podcast series called Hidden Levels.
item.dc:creator: Mallory Yu

item.title: 'I witnessed him call America to live up to its ideals,' Sen. Raphael Warnock on Jesse Jackson and America's voting rights
item.description: Senator Raphael Warnock talks about the legacy of the Jesse Jackson.
item.content:encoded: Senator Raphael Warnock talks about the legacy of the Jesse Jackson.
item.dc:creator: Kai McNamee

item.title: How NPR reporters built an archive to document January 6th
item.description: Five years ago, a mob stormed the U.S. Capitol with the goal of stopping the certification of the presidential election. NPR's Tom Dreisbach wanted to preserve a record of the moments before, during, and after the attacks for future generations.
item.content:encoded: Five years ago, a mob stormed the U.S. Capitol with the goal of stopping the certification of the presidential election. NPR's Tom Dreisbach wanted to preserve a record of the moments before, during, and after the attacks for future generations.
item.dc:creator: Barrie Hardymon

item.title: Mississippi health system shuts down clinics statewide after ransomware attack
item.description: The attack was launched on Thursday and prompted hospital officials to close all of its 35 clinics across the state.
item.content:encoded:
The attack was launched on Thursday and prompted hospital officials to close all of its 35 clinics across the state.

(Image credit: Rogelio V. Solis)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Blizzard conditions and high winds forecast for NYC, East coast
item.description: The winter storm is expected to bring blizzard conditions and possibly up to 2 feet of snow in New York City.
item.content:encoded:
The winter storm is expected to bring blizzard conditions and possibly up to 2 feet of snow in New York City.

(Image credit: Andres Kudacki)
item.dc:creator: Selena Simmons-Duffin

item.title: Vietnam Veterans sue to block proposed 'Independence Arch' near Arlington National Cemetery
item.description: The lawsuit challenges President Trump's plans for "Independence Arch," a 250-foot structure proposed for Memorial Circle.
item.content:encoded:
The lawsuit challenges President Trump's plans for "Independence Arch," a 250-foot structure proposed for Memorial Circle.

(Image credit: Nathan Howard)
item.dc:creator: Windsor Johnston

item.title: Trump to raise global tariffs to 15%
item.description: President Trump previously said he would implement 10% global tariffs after the U.S. Supreme Court struck down his tariff policies.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump previously said he would implement 10% global tariffs after the U.S. Supreme Court struck down his tariff policies.

(Image credit: Aaron Schwartz)
item.dc:creator: Kristin Wright

item.title: Pin trading has taken over the Olympics. Here's what it's like in Milan
item.description: Pin trading has become a hallmark of the Olympics in recent decades — and not just for athletes. An official trading center in Milan was a hotspot for longtime collectors and curious newcomers alike.
item.content:encoded:
Pin trading has become a hallmark of the Olympics in recent decades — and not just for athletes. An official trading center in Milan was a hotspot for longtime collectors and curious newcomers alike.

(Image credit: Rachel Treisman)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman
